USB drive 128gb Internal chip adopts advanced packaging technology and has waterproof, compressive, drop, high temperature, properties, effectively protecting data

【USB 3.2 FLASH DRIVE】: USB jump drive with USB 3.2 gen 1 hardware interface and Type C dual interface. No need to install any software, plug and play. 360-degree rotatable design, seamless connection. The USB storage flash drive is suitable for Android Phones MacBooks Laptops Computers, etc.

【WIDE COMPATIBILITY】: Our 128gb flash drive can be used widely, Suitable for Windows 7 / 8 / 10 / Vista / XP / Unix / 2000 / ME / NT Linux. Support video formats: AVI, M4V, MKV, MOV, M P4, MPG, RM, RMVB, TS, WMV, FLV, 3GP; AUDIOS: FLAC, APE, AAC, AIF, M4A, MP3, WAV. And compatible with most USB 1.1, USB 2.0, and USB 3.0 ports

【QUALITY ASSURANCE】: The USB drive 128 gb needs to pass 14 performance tests such as crystal oscillator test, anti-aging test, speed test, etc. before it can be put into the market. 12-Month Warranty and Lifetime Technology Support

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars works as expected.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent flash drive for less than $5 per drive
reviews.reviewText: This is a decent pack of 5 flash drives at a reasonable price. It is USB 2.0 which ensures that file transfer rates will not be as fast as more current technology, but for my use (I primarily use them for documents, not for music or videos) they will come in handy. The exterior shell of each drive is stainless steel, so feel like they will hold up well. Since I usually have them in a pocket in my purse, I generally prefer that my drives have a cover over the end to keep dust/debris from getting inside the drive - but again, for the price and my anticipated usage, these drives will work well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality and great price
reviews.reviewText: I used them for school work. And it comes with 5 usb flash drives so I shared them with my friends and they loved them too. It’s also very lightweight and metal shell part is tight. Very nice purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very solidly made metal casing with both USB-A and C thumb drive giving versatility to use with various devices. I did not measure speed but use to both transfer and store files without issue thus far. Biggest issue to me always is whether the memory is reliable or has an unacceptable error rate and it is too early to tell with this one though the craftsmanship of the device itself is excellent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This little thumb drive is going to quickly become a regularly used gadget. The USB type-C works flawlessly when I plug it into my Pixel 6a. It's aluminium or some alloy and it feels nice in my hands. Seemingly sturdy and well-built with a good hinge. And lastly a little passthrough for a lanyard.Gets a bit warm to the touch after transferring large (GB+) files which I'll monitor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars ABSOLUTE TRASH BUYER BEWARE
reviews.reviewText: Ordered a 2 pack, was sent a single package of one drive. Needed it for travel immediately, so rather than wait to go through the return process and get the correct pack of 2 items, I began using the first. Copied some files onto the drive, transfer speed was excellent at first, first couple of gigs of files went on with no problems. About an hour later I initiiated another file transfer of about the same size. I noticed the transfer speed slowing down severely as time went on. By the time it completes the transfer it was down to 10 MB/s.I was a bit concerned, but continued preparing my files for transfer. Half hour later or so I again initiated a file transfer of around 2.5 G.Transfer speed this time around began at around 20 MB/s. Every 30 seconds or so the speed lowered by 1 MB/s. At around 80 percent complete it was moving at a blazing speed of 1 MB/s, until it eventually stopped altogether and my file manager notified me that the transfer had failed.I opened the file manager, to find absolutely nothing showing up on the drive at all. Ejected the drive with the file manager. When I went to remove and reconnect so it would possibly reboot the drive and detect my files again, the drive itself was BURNING hot. Hot enough that the metal casing scalded my fingers.Needless to say when I reinserted the drive after it had cooled a while later, there were no files there. It lost all of my data, luckily I had only copied it rather than do a cut-and-paste operation.DO NOT BUY THIS "HOT GARBAGE".After only approximately 7G of file transferring, this thing almost literally caught on fire. Probably would have damaged my device if I had been doing a larger transfer all at once and had not been right there to oversee it.This is just one in a rapidly growing string of quality issues on items I have bought on prime lately. Quality of products has diminished immensely in the last year, and I am seriously considering uninstalling and cancelling my membership at this point. Sure, they return and replace items when stuff like this happens, but who has the time or the energy to keep going to the store to drop off returns, waiting for the new one, etc. If I had time to go to the store I would have just gone to Best Buy or Walmart. Why am I paying a monthly subscription for aggravation???Update. Three weeks later and I still have not received my refund from this scammer that Amazon is in bed with. I have returned hundreds of items over the years, and up until now I have never had to wait more than a few hours to get my money back.At this point I am done with Amazon. They have become 1996 eBay, full of inferior or even products and scam listings that do not correctly depict the items they will send you.Sad to see the empire bezos built from his garage falling apart at the seams like this. Amazon now prioritizes getting their cut of the sales from the seller, and now sacrifices the customer on an alter of greed rather than lose a couple dollars in revenue.Goodbye, GreedAzon. I hope as many people as you screw over leave and take their business elsewhere. I hope it gets to the point where your DPS system is unsustainable, and the whole thing collapses under the weight of the fat, slimy sleazebags running the show these days.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Functional 64GB storeage; USB2
reviews.reviewText: For the price ($4/stick; 16GB/$1) I think it would be a good deal. The shell seems solid from a drop test perspective. I didn't see any scratches appear on it.It is USB-A in connection, not USBCIt is USB 2.0 (not 3.2) -> speeds theoretically would be 480 Mbps vs 20 Gbps. I'm really uncertain why this would be such an old tech...2.0 came out in 2000 vs USB 3.0 in 2008 vs USB 3.2 in 2017...and it's 2023...almost 2024. Meh. 64GB for a semi-disposable USB drive is huge...It's functional.None of the drives arrived DOA.Lightweight, sleek designI didn't like the fact that there were no covers. I wish the proximal part was slightly bigger to permit a cap to be added...but I also get why people would have USB drives like this.Has a hole for attaching to your keys.Has a warranty with an unknown period.Unsure if waterproof, doubtful given design.Packaging was simple.1* off primarily because it's USB 2.0 and there's no cap, though that latter part is personal preference.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as intended, great little drive
reviews.reviewText: The speed and size are good, and it's nice being able to use USB A and C.I didn't realize how handy having both would be until I ran out of regular USB ports on my laptop and needed to transfer files still, so instead of unplugging something, it was super handy
